channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Two mead road down to about numbers 6 several deep pot holes, 19th January
item.description:
From just past junction of old Bath road /mead road up and past number two mead road end Several large deep potholes and it’s very tricky to avoid when riding my bike and a car coming in the other direction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Mead Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Significant pothole, 19th January
item.description:
There is a significant pothole on Frogfurlong. This road now has much more traffic than usual because of ongoing closures on Parton Road and Down Hatherley Lane.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frog Furlong Lane, Innsworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Cycle Lane full of debris, rubbish and leaves, 19th January
item.description:
As you leave Cheltenham going up the hill to Seven Springs the bike path (which was created when the road was repaired at a cost of ££££) is unusable due to the fact that it is never cleaned or road swept. Riding this way to work every week is impossible, forcing me into busy 60mph carriageway. A deep clean is needed then a routine needs to be created to keep it useable.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
